text: I asked this a while back and was told there isn't one at this time
Ok. I'll give it a try. Thanks

A general question about Hubdb and it's potential: Right now we have one table that powers three different sections of the website. The table consists of speakers and it's like 200+ entries right now and will grow into 450ish by the end of year with duplicates (there are duplicates already in the db). The page load time (<http://datacoucil.ai/speakers|datacoucil.ai/speakers>) is also significantly grown as the page grows. My question is we're planning to split the table into atleast 3 or even 4 different tables so the backend would essentially become an RDBMS and is Hubdb a good solution for this. Is there a performance downside if we split this big table into multiple tables. Or should we switch to an actual RDBMS backend and use it to build the solution.

also, at what point in time i should be worried about the performance issues with Hubdb with regards to data (like how many entries in different tables, couple thousand, more or less ?) this is just in case we decide to stick to hubdb for now
